content:
Add a Radio Input Element to a FlexCard

To add a radio input element on a FlexCard, follow these steps:

From the Build panel, click Inputs and drag the Radio element onto the canvas.

Configure properties common to all Input elements:

* In Field Binding, bind the value of the input element to an existing or new data field.
* In Field Label, enter the label that appears next to the element.
* Check Required if the user must enter or select a value for this input element.
* Check Read-only to disable the ability to modify the input values.
* In Help Text, enter helpful text about the purpose of the input field.

Select the Display Mode for your radio items:

* Vertical: Displays radios stacked on top of each other.
* Horizontal: Displays radios inline.
* Button Group: Displays options as inline buttons.
* Image: Displays options as images.
* Color: Displays options as colored circles.

If Display Mode is Image or Color, configure additional properties:

* Width and Height for the image or circle.
* Image Count Per Row or Count Per Row for the number of items to display per row.
* Enable Caption to display the label underneath the image.
* Enter the name of a CSS color or HEX code if the Display Mode is Color.

To enter options, click + Add New in the Options section and configure properties such as Label, Value, and Use As a Default Value. 

Click + Add Action to execute an action when a user interacts with the input element.

(Optional) Click Style to open the Style panel and style your element.
title: Adding Radio Input Element to FlexCard
